member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.#ctor(Opc.Ua.ITransportChannel,Opc.Ua.ApplicationConfiguration,Opc.Ua.ConfiguredEndpoint,System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the session.
member.param: The channel used to communicate with the server.
The configuration for the client application.
The endpoint use to initialize the channel.
The certificate to use for the client.
member.remarks: The application configuration is used to look up the certificate if none is provided. The clientCertificate must have the private key. This will require that the certificate be loaded from a certicate store. Converting a DER encoded blob to a X509Certificate2 will not include a private key.

The user identity to associate with the session.

member.summary: Sends an additional publish request.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.OnPublishComplete(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Completes an asynchronous publish operation.

member.summary: Sends a republish request.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.ProcessPublishResponse(Opc.Ua.ResponseHeader,System.UInt32,Opc.Ua.UInt32Collection,System.Boolean,Opc.Ua.NotificationMessage)
member.summary: Processes the response from a publish request.

member.name: M:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.OnRaisePublishNotification(System.Object)
member.summary: Raises an event indicating that publish has returned a notification.

member.name: E:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.KeepAlive
member.summary: Raised when a keep alive arrives from the server or an error is detected.
member.remarks: Once a session is created a timer will periodically read the server state and current time. If this read operation succeeds this event will be raised each time the keep alive period elapses. If an error is detected (KeepAliveStopped == true) then this event will be raised as well.

member.name: E:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.Notification
member.summary: Raised when a notification message arrives in a publish response.
member.remarks: All publish requests are managed by the Session object. When a response arrives it is validated and passed to the appropriate Subscription object and this event is raised.

member.name: E:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.PublishError
member.summary: Raised when an exception occurs while processing a publish response.
member.remarks: Exceptions in a publish response are not necessarily fatal and the Session will attempt to recover by issuing Republish requests if missing messages are detected. That said, timeout errors may be a symptom of a OperationTimeout that is too short when compared to the shortest PublishingInterval/KeepAliveCount amount the current Subscriptions. The OperationTimeout should be twice the minimum value for PublishingInterval*KeepAliveCount.

member.name: E:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.SubscriptionsChanged
member.summary: Raised when a subscription is added or removed

member.name: E:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.SessionClosing
member.summary: Raised to indicate the session is closing.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.ConfiguredEndpoint

member.summary: Gets the name assigned to the session.

member.summary: Gets the period for wich the server will maintain the session if there is no communication from the client.

member.summary: Gets the local handle assigned to the session

member.summary: Gets the user identity currently used for the session.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.DefaultSubscription
member.summary: Gets or Sets the default subscription for the session.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets or Sets how frequently the server is pinged to see if communication is still working.
member.remarks: This interval controls how much time elaspes before a communication error is detected. If everything is ok the KeepAlive event will be raised each time this period elapses.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.KeepAliveStopped
member.summary: Returns true if the session is not receiving keep alives.
member.remarks: Set to true if the server does not respond for 2 times the KeepAliveInterval. Set to false is communication recovers.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.LastKeepAliveTime
member.summary: Gets the time of the last keep alive.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.OutstandingRequestCount
member.summary: Gets the number of outstanding publish or keep alive requests.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.DefunctRequestCount
member.summary: Gets the number of outstanding publish or keep alive requests which appear to hung.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Session.GoodPublishRequestCount
member.summary: Gets the number of good outstanding publish requests.

member.summary: Raised before a reconnect operation completes.

member.name: T:Opc.Ua.Client.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Opc.Ua.Client namespace defines classes which can be used to implement a UA client. These classes manage client side state information, provide higher level abstractions for UA tasks such as managing sessions/subscriptions and saving/restoring connection information for later use.

member.summary: Defines string constants for SDK version information.

member.summary: The current build version.

member.summary: The maximum number of notifications per publish request.

member.summary: The priority assigned to subscription.

member.summary: The timestamps to return with the notification messages.

member.summary: The minimum lifetime for subscriptions in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Subscription.DisableMonitoredItemCache
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the notifications are cached within the monitored items.
member.value: true if monitored item cache is disabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Applications must process the Session.Notication event if this is set to true. This flag improves performance by eliminating the processing involved in updating the cache.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Subscription.FastDataChangeCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the fast data change callback.
member.remarks: Only one callback is allowed at a time but it is more efficient to call than an event.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Subscription.FastEventCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the fast event callback.
member.remarks: Only one callback is allowed at a time but it is more efficient to call than an event.

member.summary: The items to monitor.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Subscription.SavedMonitoredItems
member.summary: Allows the list of monitored items to be saved/restored when the object is serialized.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Subscription.ChangesPending
member.summary: Returns true if the subscription has changes that need to be applied.

member.summary: Returns the number of monitored items.

member.summary: The session that owns the subscription item.

member.summary: A local handle assigned to the subscription

member.summary: The unique identifier assigned by the server.

member.summary: Whether the subscription has been created on the server.

member.summary: The current lifetime count.

member.summary: Whether publishing is currently enabled.

member.name: P:Opc.Ua.Client.Subscription.CurrentPriority
member.summary: The priority assigned to subscription when it was created.
